page.title: 01Introduction To Jedburgh
page.content: Our area is mainly farmland dominated by the country town of Jedburgh(pop. approx.4000).This Royal Burgh has a long history and is first mentioned in the 9th.century.It was important in the past because of its proximity to the Border and was the scene of much strife. Jedburgh's main industry is now the production of precision tools and hacksaw blades and of secondary importance a plastics factory and smaller factories producing knitwear. The town because of its situation on a main road North has many tourists for whom it has much to offer such as places of historical interest, sporting activities a traditional game of Handba,and Callant's Festival all amid natural beauty.Many tourists purchase Jethart snails.
